Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above two white lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (mouth and snout remaining) to right; at right, part of triangular motif; part of spike rosette and possible second one as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0584) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 63 (Other Accession Number)
